data.title: Negative Component ID's problem
HashMap does not support for_range iteration in windows android build
Misc. improvement for the build system
data.body:
Currently the generated Urho3D.pc file is not entirely correct. There are at least two things we could improve.
1. It may still erroneously expose some of the compiler defines that are really required only when building the library and not when using the library.
2. The linker flags are erroneously prepared as if user would always want to link against the library statically, i.e. we actually need less linker flags when linking dynamically.

data.title: what's the use of basePath in PackageTool?
data.body: inside PackageTool.cpp, basePath_  is assigned a value but never used. So what's the use of basePath in this tool?

data.title: Upgrade LuaJIT to v2.1 (unstable) branch
data.body:
Continued discussion from #1137.

The v2.1 branch seems to have support for 64-bit ARM arch. It is tempting to enable LuaJIT interpreter for iOS platform this time round.

data.title: Cppformat
data.body:
I was interested in the suggestion posted in this issue: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/472

This adds cppformat to Urho3D and exposes some python-like string formatting functions that can be used in script too.

This is a WIP and open to suggestion.

data.title: Direction support for particle/billboard
data.body:
This pull request will add particle direction inspired by Unity stretched billboard particles. If any of you have tried that on Unity, stretched particle can create pseudo 3d effect despite still using billboard. It can be really useful for sparking effects and many other stuffs. 

Screenshot:
![partikel_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5253453/12228806/c5337502-b872-11e5-8836-46a80402e7dd.png)

You can see this particle in action at example 'Particle/Burst.xml' or just see this youtube video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zR7KtF6qtaU

About the implementation, I modify the billboard object to store direction. This data only works if new face camera mode FC_DIRECTION is used. If this mode is used, billboard will rotate facing camera with direction as axis, so it will create pseudo 3D effect. Because every billboard has different rotation, Urho needs to calculate rotation for every billboard. For now, CPU is doing those calculation, but I have plan to move them to the GPU.

What do you guys think?

data.title: The minidump path is hard coded
data.body:
Hello,
When a minidump is generated, the file is always saved at AppData/Roaming/Urho3D/crashdumps (for windows).
The path is hard coded in MiniDump.cpp. And it would be nice if we can define a new path (with for exampe engineParameters_ ?)

data.title: Unified ci rake task
data.body:
Originally this branch was intended only to unify the 'ci' rake task used by the AppVeyor and Travis-CI to reduce code duplication and hopefully easier for future maintenance. Ruby script is a good match with CMake to target multiple-platforms, so the unification can be done without much trouble. However, while working on this, through the CI jobs I discovered a genuine configuration defect for iOS platform and was able to fix it. And one thing follows another I realized the URHO3D_LUAJIT should be baked into the export header because once the LuaJIT is enabled then the linking with the Urho3D library requires some extra linker flags. The only way to ensure downstream projects get these extra linker flags is to have the URHO3D_LUAJIT baked in. And while moving the bits for the extra linker flags I realized there is a refactoring opportunity to get rid of the `setup_macosx_linker_flags()`, `setup_ios_linker_flags()`, and `setup_emscripten_linker_flags()` macros. The `setup_macosx_linker_flags()` macro needs to be called explicitly by library users in the past when targeting OSX. After refactoring this is not needed anymore, i.e. the linker flags should be correctly configured for all the supported platforms without user intervention. It also takes care the LuaJIT specific linker flags automatically as mentioned earlier.

Other than the above, the branch also:
- Rename `cmake_macosx.sh` script to `cmake_xcode.sh` so it is more consistent with the other script names which are based on generator name.
- Rename "Emscripten" platform to "Web" platform.
- Enable GCC color diagnostics when it is supported (GCC 4.9.1+).
- Fix the generic batch file and shell script to propagate out the exit code from CMake.

I think the branch is now ready to be merged into master branch. Let me know if there are any objections.

data.title: undefined references to Variant::Get<type> (shared linking)
data.body:
`In function `Urho3D::AttributeAccessorImpl<TailGenerator, bool, Urho3D::AttributeTrait<bool> >::Set(Urho3D::Serializable*, Urho3D::Variant const&)':
urho/build/include/urho3d/scene/serializable.h:258: undefined reference to `bool Urho3D::Variant::Get<bool>() const'`

These are occuring for bool, float, unsigned int, Color, ResourceRef..
It's possible I've missed something... advice welcome, and thanks.

data.title: Intermittent build failure when LuaJIT is enabled
data.body:
Our RPI CI jobs have been configured to run using 4 worker process (i.e. -j4 when using Makefile generator) and it caused the intermittent build failure. Mostly success but lately the frequency of failure increases for some reasons. I have experimented to reduce the number to 3 thinking that it should make the build more stable. To my surprise, 5 out of 6 RPI CI jobs failed the build test. It looks like the change actually aggravates the issue and makes it more reproducible instead. But why? The issue is not limited to Travis-CI. At least we have one confirmed case being reported by user in the forum (see http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic1708.html)

There is something fishy going on here.

data.title: In AnimatedModel, bone nodes are saved
data.body:
Hello,
I created an AnimatedModel, I disabled the save for this component, and I assigned a skeleton :
`AnimatedModel* model = node_->CreateComponent<AnimatedModel>();`
`model->SetTemporary(true);`
`model->SetModel(...);`

But when the scene is saved, the bone nodes are saved too. It's quite annoying because it spams the save file with useless nodes.

I don't know if it's a bug, but a solution to solve this can be to add:
`boneNode->SetTemporary(true);`
 after the line 738 in AnimatedModel.cpp :

data.title: Bullet Physics issues
Destroing scene in a HandleNodeCollision
data.body:
When a player arrives to the finish point

```
void LevelLogic::HandleNodeCollision(StringHash eventType, VariantMap& eventData)
{
    using namespace NodeCollision;
    RigidBody* body = static_cast<RigidBody*>(eventData[P_BODY].GetPtr());
    RigidBody* otherBody = static_cast<RigidBody*>(eventData[P_OTHERBODY].GetPtr());
    Node* otherNode = static_cast<Node*>(eventData[P_OTHERNODE].GetPtr());
    bool trigger = eventData[P_TRIGGER].GetBool();
    VectorBuffer contacts = eventData[P_CONTACTS].GetBuffer();
    Vector3 pos = contacts.ReadVector3(); // Buffer containing position (Vector3), normal (Vector3), distance (float), impulse (float) for each contact

    if (trigger && otherNode->GetName() == "Finish")
    {
        NextLevel();
    }
}
```

the game load next level and set it as current (I no longer need to be stored in the memory old scene). The old scene is automatically destroyed. This raises an exception in Physics world.

Stack:

data.title: Update Virtual Joystick/Touch Input Controls
data.body:
More of an enhancement, as the current onscreen joystick functions more like a D-Pad with little space and you have to make sure you press up and right (for example) to trigger/move diagonally. Maybe something similar with other toolkits and mobile engine implementation that has a circle restriction and pulls back to the center when you let go of the virtual stick.

Example:
http://activetuts.s3.amazonaws.com/tuts/236_virtualJoystick/tutorial/tutorial/swfs/JoystickApp_006.swf

data.title: Initial commit of updating to SDL 2.0.4
data.body:
Initial commit of updating to SDL 2.0.4, I recommend not to pull this in just yet, just keep this here for safe-keeping so there's no duplicate work later once 2.0.4 is stable.

This is based on this revision:
https://hg.libsdl.org/SDL/file/734c90ea9990

The reasoning behind this is I wanted GLES 3.1 context-creation which has been patched for 2.0.4, but instead of just grabbing the latest EGL-related code I just dumped the latest SDL 2.0.4 on top and brought back the Urho3D-specific changes on top, except for a few which seem to be fixed or the code-base differs greatly. Some things like hard-code disable of the emulated mouse for Android has been omitted, as there's now a way to set this using a hint (haven't patched or tried this yet). Also some iOS 8 'hack' has been omitted as the code-base differs also.

Also changed the SDL_SendKeyboardKey function so the 'raw' keycode is called raw instead of keycode (the function now uses this variable name for something else internally). And I also patched the backends which didn't have this modification.

As always, test this code first (I haven't got every platform to test this against).
